description: On March 26, the Central African Republic has enforced the closure of extracurricular schools and universities from March 26 until the next order.

description: On January 28, the Minister of Health and Population in the Central African Republic released a statement encouraging all travelers from China entering the country to fill out health forms and be checked at a health facility if experiencing symptoms.

On 17 April 2020 the National Biology Laboratory of Bangui accepted a  COVID-19 screening device from the MINUSCA Rwanda Contingent, which will help ramp up the CAR Ministry of Healthâ€™s efforts to identify infected people in order to stop the spread of the virus and save lives.

The Central African Republic (CAR) has received 10,000 protective masks, airlifted by Plan International to support the war-torn country in combating COVID-19.

The aid cargo was sent on a humanitarian flight organised by a group of NGOs, including Plan International, with support from the European Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid Operations department (ECHO).

The plane left Lyon for Bangui this morning on the 8th of May, carrying PPE and medical supplies contributed by 13 international aid agencies.

On 6 March 2020, the Minister of Health in the Central African Republic announced that all travelers entering the country would be tested and classified as "without risk","with symptoms despite not staying in a zone confirmed of local transmission", "contact with COVID-19", and "suspected case of COVID-19".
On April 24, the Central African Republic has announced that taken a grant to increase the testing and mitigation capabilities.
type_text: On April 24, the Central African Republic has announced that taken a grant to increase the testing and mitigation capabilities.

description: On March 13, the government of the Central African Republic established a coronavirus hotline (French and Sango), where citizens could call 1212 to ask questions or report possible exposure.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19

description: On March 14, WHO and the Ministry of Health and Population started raising awareness on things to know, the importance of not giving in to panic and steps to prevent the disease, on WASH hygiene and social distancing. An alert number of the Ministry of Health and Population was set to report storage cases.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19

description: On March 27, the Central African Republic declared a 14 to 20 day quarantine of those suspected of infection, barring medical decisions.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On March 29, the Central African Republic imposed a mandatory 14-day self-quarantine from March 29 until the next order for any person entering CAR coming from a location with local transmission of COVID-19.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: On March 27, the Central African Republic ordered the closing of bars, clubs, restaurants, cafes, and refreshment stalls for 15 days.

description: On March 26, the Central African Republic announced the suspension of religious ceremonies and cults gathering more than 15 people.

On 26 May, the Ministry of Health and Population (MoHP) issued instructions on the compulsory wearing of masks in public transports, shops, offices and for some professions including medical personnel, taxi drivers and humanitarian workers.
